fields.description:
Is it possible to get some kind of branch manager?

We use Issue Branching(Feature Branching) and after some time there just sits tons of merged branches that now have to be deleted one at a time if you don't go through the Pull Request flow

Is it possible that nome cleanup tool can be make so that a bunch of branches can be deleted in one go?
fields.summary: Bulk delete branches (BB-14660)

G Vamshi

.bas files use QBasic in Pygments server-side rendering of the view pages\\
Make these match up.
fields.summary: Use VB.NET mode/lexer in code highlighters for both view and edit pages in source view and snippets (BB-14573)

fields.description: Pretty trivial but if you can make it wider so I can see the branch name without having to click that would be awesome - see attachment. Thanks!
fields.summary: Make repository dropdown wider (BB-14616)

fields.description:
Hi there,

My company uses BitBucket, and the Diff view in the Pull Request page is critical for us for making Code Reviews on changes.\\
As I recently noticed, the marking of changed rows was changed to simply be grey, without highlighting the change itself.\\
This makes going over the code an almost impossible job. Every tiny change of a parameter can now cause a whole lot of colored lines, which cannot be easily ignored, as you cannot see that there are no other changes to this row/code block.

Please bring back the highlighted segment in the changed line, to help us come back to use the Diff tool. We started moving to external tools for now...

Thanks,\\
Ido Frizler (Adallom).
fields.summary: Diff feature in Pull Request page ruined...

fields.description: Fuse is the UX tool suite for app designers and developers, more info can be found here: https://www.fusetools.com/ . It will help to differentiate between various projects and to customize workflows to cater to the specifics of Fuse.
fields.summary: Add Fuse as an option for repository language (BB-14773)
reStructured Text: initial indents are ignored in line blocks (starting with "|") (BB-14659)

fields.description:
Is there a way to submit a pull request from a wiki in a forked repository to the wiki in the "upstream" repository?

If not can that feature be added?
fields.summary: Submit a pull request to a wiki from a forked repository (BB-14658)

fields.description:
The POST service had a 'website' field in repository->website that showed the content you filled in Settings -> Repository Details -> Website from Bitbucket's UI.

However, the new Webhooks do not seem to have such a field.

Is it possible to add the website url to the payload? I feel that this upgrade should not have less information than the previous alternative.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Webhooks do not have repository website (BB-15170)

fields.description:
My source code extension is .mq4 which is written by mt4 script language. When creating repository, the language I leave it blank, because there is no file type supporting it.

After pushing files to the repository, this type of files are not able to be viewed. But I see "View Raw" instead. clicking the view raw link it downloads the file instead of showing it in editor.

I've tried to recreate a clean repository but no luck.

the source code is pure text file that can be opened by any text editors. I attached a sample file for your info.
fields.summary: Bitbucket doesn't show source file contents in text but view raw

fields.description: Currently, if you need to reset your password, Bitbucket sends the reset email to all email addresses on the account.  This could present an issue if an organization is trying to get access to a personal account, as they can request a password reset, and get control of the account.
fields.summary: Only send password reset emails to primary address on account. (BB-14617)

fields.description:
* Using the bitbucket API (https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/changesets-resource-296095208.html#changesetsResource-POSTanewcommentonachangeset) I'm trying to post a comment on a changeset of a full new file. I tried to comment on several lines (-1, 0, 1, 10, ...) and the comment is done but it is not possible to see it anywhere. I can only comment in the file, not in a line. Example: https://bitbucket.org/pedrorijo91/ttttt/commits/bf096764b85e10eeb123cb6dfa4ed9cbcb6a4f01?at=master#chg-conf.rb

fields.description:
All we would need is a POST to https://leanpub.com/BOOK_SLUG/preview.json?api_key=API_KEY. This would trigger a preview of the book contained in the bitbucket repo.

More info on the Leanpub API is here: https://leanpub.com/help/api#previewing

The user would need to provide the BOOK_SLUG and API_KEY fields.

I'm happy to help if you have any more questions.

Scott
fields.summary: Create Service Hook for Leanpub

fields.description:
Currently, having a public repository allows anyone to create public forks.  The problem with this is that someone searching for a repository hosted on Bitbucket will also see all the forks and won't know which one is the master without intimate Bitbucket knowledge.

Instead, it would great if a public repository would allow the same forking control as a private repository has "Allow forks", "Allow only private forks", "No forks".

The way it is now, it has forced me to remove all source code from the repository and just upload packaged files without the ability for others to fork and submit changes.  In other words, I can't use version control at all with this feature missing.
fields.summary: Public repository, but allow only private forks (BB-14760)

fields.description: Side-by-side diff dialog shows both versions of the file, but all changes are highlighted in gray, so it is impossible to differentiate the changes made.
fields.summary: Side-by-side diff does not highlight changes

Hello,

I have an existing git repository our team has been working on in the last 2 years, today we decided to move the bare repository to BitBucket but I tried twice to import it from our server (using protocol http://) and after the import loads all the data (at least that's what I guess because it takes several minutes and after that I don't see connections open on our apache local server), the progressive bar stops at around 80%, the textarea below continues growing (loooong list of "....") until the process terminate (after hours) with an error message that says max execution time has been reached....

This is an import task still running now after almost 2 hours:\\
https://bitbucket.org/repo/import/682800

What can I do ?
fields.summary: Bitbucket freezes while Importing an existing git repository (about 200MB)

to give zip with base like\\

fields.description:
Based on: BCLOUD-11892

Anything over 500 tags will break the functionality of the tags endpoint. We should improve the v2 API to include a paginated version of tags listed.
fields.summary: Improve v2 API to include 'tags' endpoint (BB-14428)

fields.description:
Hi,

we have a problem with repo:push webhooks on two of our repos. The request list says that response status is 404, and indeed, webhook requests never reach our packagist instance. Those two repos have the same webhook URL as some of our other repos which work fine.

I've tried deleting the repos and recreating them, but it didn't help.

Since the repos are private, if you need details on which repos are affected, contact me privately and I'll gladly provide more info.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Some webhooks not working

fields.description:
If there is a repo with a huge amount of tags (> 500 tags), when trying to get the tags using API v1, it will either take up a long time to fetch them or error 500 may occur.

Pagination is only available in the v2 of the API, it doesn't work on v1.

Is it possible to speed up the API resource or have the possibility to paginate the calls on v1?
fields.summary: Too many tags in repo causes error when trying to fetch the tags via API

fields.description:
When I pull up a pull request page on my browser, I get a list of the files that have changed.\\
For each file, I get the diffs in a single view with the changes marked by grey, red (deletions) or green (additions) highlighting.\\
However when I click on the button for the "Side-by-side diff" the colored highlighting is now broken. It shows grey without the red/green in some of the places, where it used to show the changes. This makes it harder to read the differences.\\
I think it may happen in sections of code that have both deletions and additions because the sections that are only additions still show green and the sections that are only deletions show red. If a section of code has additions and deletions on the same line it just shows all grey and you can no longer see the characters that have changed
fields.summary: Side-by-side diff does not show proper highlighting (BB-14424)

fields.description:
And possible a similar thing for issues.

See also: BCLOUD-3442

fields.summary: Unable to change forking in repo settings. (BB-14426)

fields.description:
The issues list page is non-functional if the screen/zoom settings make the page too narrow horizontally. The title column gets so small it actually disappears entirely.

This makes it impossible to even click on the issue, let along read what it's name is. The issues list has become unusable to me.

Just put a minimum width on the table and add a horizontal scrollbar if the user's zoom settings make the page too narrow for all of the columns. I mean, GitHub manages to make this work.
fields.summary: Issues list is unreadable if the screen is narrow (BB-14427)

fields.description: We have webhooks set up on two of our repositories. They are firing on different triggers. One fires on repo:push & pullrequest:fulfilled, the other on repo:push, pullrequest:created & pullrequest:updated. None of these webhooks are working today. It isn't that I need to whitelist the IP ranges. When I check the 'view requests' link it shows no requests fired since yesterday when I've been pushing branches and creating / updating pull requests.  Is there a service outage or is there something wrong in my repositories?
fields.summary: Webhooks not firing

fields.description: Webhooks (push and pullrequest.MERGED) on my repository are delayed up to 15min (if at they show up at all - as it's difficult to keep track of which webhooks have been started with such a delay)
fields.summary: webhooks delayed

fields.description: The images which where uploaded into a wiki should be saved in the wiki repository and not somewhere else (to have everything in one place).
fields.summary: Upload for wiki images should be saved in wiki repository

fields.description:
Create a function in the bitbucket page for a repository to "release" a new version.  It should have a field for the version number, name, and description.  Then it should update the last commit with a tag matching the version number.

A separate event could be used called "release" or users could just hook in using the push webhook and check for presence of a tag to determine if a new release was created for a plugin, app, etc.

This feature exists on Github.com already.
fields.summary: Add Release Function in Repositories (BB-14394)

fields.description:
When reviewing a pull request, any in-line comments do not show up in the Activity tab for the parent Pull Request.

Expected behavior:\\
Any comments made on commits referenced by the PR should show up in the Activity tab such that the submitter (or other reviewers) can easily track _activity_ on the code contained in the PR. This should mirror a subset of the activity feed listed on the repository's dashboard.

Actual behavior:\\
Specific commits are badged with a small comment icon and number, but aren't listed anywhere in the activity tab. There is no simple way to jump to a specific comment. PR submitters often miss in-line comments on submitted code.

Support case #: BBS-22789
fields.summary: Pull Request Activity does not include code-level comments from referenced commits (BB-14391)

fields.description: Bitbucket repository logo upload field does't clip repository logo to repository logo upload bounds. Because of this I can drag repository image as far as I want, even out of repository image upload field. This makes hard to set pixel perfect repository logo.
fields.summary: Repository logo doesn't clip to bounds (BB-14401)

fields.description: It would be nice if there was a team account setting that can be enabled to only allow user accounts with two-factor authentication enabled or some kind of check from the team account to see who has it enabled/disabled.
fields.summary: Force team members to use two-factor authentication

fields.description:
Hi,

Can you please help me the setup a post-recieve hook so when i push code on Bitbucket repository from my local machine after then latest code automatically deploy on my EC2 Ubuntu server.

Thanks\\
Arvind
fields.summary: Auto deploy ruby on rails appplication

fields.description:
Hi,

I have a situation where the BitBucket repo is the only place that contains an orphaned commit. Nobody else has a copy of the branch it was on, or of the commit itself. I really need to be able to fetch that commit and it's parent commits.

If there was a way to tag a commit on the server, I could use {{git fetch}} to retrieve it. But unfortunately it is not possible. This is addressed in issue BCLOUD-7399.

Another way could be to SSH into the server and perform the steps described [here|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/25416003/clone-a-git-repository-and-keep-unreachable-commits#answer-25416117]. Of course this is not possible since I do not maintain the server . Duh. If I could SSH, I could also tag the commit using Git CLI.

It looks like right now there is absolutely no way for me to retrieve the commit I want, even though I know it's exact complete SHA-1, and I can access it's BB page in the browser by typing in https://bitbucket.org/<user>/<repo>/commits/<sha-1>.

This is very disappointing, very frustrating and is probably going to cause waste of several hours of work. Please fix. I really need that commit, and I am sure I'm not alone.
fields.summary: Cannot retrieve orphaned commit

fields.description:
I'm trying to merge a pull request that has no conflicts. Pressing the button does nothing, but when I open the dev tools, I see there's a Javascript error.

Attached is a screenshot of the error... If it can help you.

Here's the content of the version info:

English\\
Git 2.1.1\\
Mercurial 2.9\\
Django 1.7.8\\
Python 2.7.3\\
1b1c5920eaf5 / 1b1c5920eaf5 @ app22
fields.summary: Merge button does nothing

fields.description: Whenever you push an empty new branch, the HC notification shows up as "5+ commits pushed to branch X by Y", even though the branch was pushed with zero new commits.
fields.summary: Bitbucket notification messages for empty branch PUSH shows multiple commits made. (HC-21403)

fields.description:
I have an application that is creating and deleting hooks for repositories of users.

In the code we query the hooks of a repo and then decide what to do next.\\
This is an example of request we are doing:

https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/lobengula3rd/carsstore/hooks/?access_token=*users access token**

After we add a hook the GET request of getting all the hooks still returns and old response without the newly added hook.

When i looked in the headers of the response i can see that there is a header:\\
'x-cache-status': HIT

Why is this response being signaled as cached when the resources have been changed?\\
This is really a bad beheaviour.

Is there a way to signify that i don't want cached results? I am very amazed this is acting like this. Why are responses of GET are being cached?

The only solution for me was to add another query string param with a dynamic value like the current date to get other this issue.\\
This is probably also occuring for all rest of apis.
fields.summary: API is returning cached results even after the resources have been changed (BB-14519)

fields.description: There is a chance that a custom link handler will be shadowed by automatic linkification of commits (and other linkifiers).
fields.summary: Custom links can be shadowed (BB-14362)

fields.description: When creating a pull request that contains an HTML file, the diff view doesn't accurately display the differences of the two versions. It seems to be getting choked on lines with comments in the HTML document and ignoring the actual changes in the file.
fields.summary: Diff in pull request doesn't properly compare HTML files.

fields.description: I can not merge the changes to the master branch that someone did ,since the merge button does not exist on my screen . Is that a known issue?!985975850-Screen%20Shot%202015-09-17%20at%202.51.32%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Missing merge button for pull request

fields.description:
If you create a snippet and select to use mercurial, mercurial will be selected by default for the next snippet you create. However, the snippet will still be created using git.

Only if you change it back to git, then back to mercurial again, will it actually use mercurial.

Also, trying to " raise a new support request from our support page" gives me a login screen where my login and password apparently don't work.
fields.summary: Snippets are created with wrong version control system (BB-14508)

fields.description: Rexx is currently not part of the "Select language..." list.
fields.summary: Add Rexx as an available language when a user is creating a repository. (BB-14655)

fields.description: Many users have requested a way to toggle the "ignore whitespace" option directly from the UI. This is a follow-on from BCLOUD-6024 which provides a query param for ignoring whitespace, but isn't sticky (meaning that it needs to be re-applied to each page view and doesn't follow the user through navigation) and requires manually appending the query param to the url.
fields.summary: "Ignore whitespace" toggle in the UI (BB-14331)

fields.description:
Can not delete my repository: https://bitbucket.org/solosystems/karalaius-mindaugo-apartamentai

System says it is not available but still we can see it
fields.summary: Can not delete my repo.

fields.description:
h2. Actions Performed
I am using a Windows 7 Desktop PC with Firefox Browser.

I visit the list of Issues in my Bitbucket project.

Say at: {{https://bitbucket.org/example/example/issues?status=new&status=open}}

##Actual Result ##

The titles of each issue are cut short and ellipsized.

h2. Expected
The titles of each issue shown in full (Wrapping over multiple lines if necessary.)

----
I found it really handy to be able to lean back and read the whole title of each issue without having to hover my mouse over it or click on it to read it in full.

This feature was what separates Bitbucket from other issue trackers.

It would be nice to have the option to see the full title of each Issue in the Issues list.
fields.summary: When Issues are listed in Issue tracker, titles are now ellipsized. (BB-14323)

fields.description: The overlay image and the close button are missing for when you click "side by side diff" on a PR.
fields.summary: Close button is missing when using a side-by-side into a Pull Request - BB-14259

fields.description:
hi

when i view all issues, it would be great to see the name of the last person to reply to an issue thread. all i can see is the person it is assigned to, but i can't tell who was the last person to reply, only the last changed date.

under the updated date it would be a simple matter to add "by {name}"

tks
fields.summary: Show last updated by user on issue list page (BB-14654)

fields.description:
Similar to: BCLOUD-10981

This seems to be an issue restricted to team groups and how the team members receive access:

# Create a group within a team with 'No' access and assign this group to a repository
# Have a team member commit/push to the team repository
# Have the team member check their overview -- notification should be missing, but when checking the team overview, the commit will be shown.

There seems to be an inconsistent way in how we show notifications for teams. Either we should:

# Assign this 'creator' notification to any team member who follows a repository, without explicitly assigning 'can create repository' access to a group
# Find out what function is showing the notifications from 'creator' access, and automatically assign this to a team's group upon creator.
fields.summary: Team member notifications are controlled by 'Creator' access in groups (BB-14290)

fields.description:
*Problem:*\\
An image with a filename containing a colons is not shown in a ticket on Bitbucket, but can be uploaded without any problems.

*Expectation*\\
If an image uploads succesfully the image will be shown succesfully, regardless of the characters used in the filename.

*Solution*\\
URL encode all filename characters or scrub the filename in such a way that the ticket will display the image.

*Details*\\
I made a screenshot with the default application on on Ubuntu 14.04 using it's default settings. This screenshot application includes spaces and colon in the filename which looks like this: 'Screenshot from 2015-09-14 20:12:46.png' I can upload this file without any issues, but displaying the image in a ticket fails silently.  See the code below which fails silently in showing a screenshot of this ticket:

!2811686068-Screenshot%20from%202015-09-14%2020:12:46.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Displaying images with spaces and colons in filename fails silently

fields.description: I created a support req (BBS-22563) and was instructed to create an issue for this. Having 2FA is a great step forward, but there is no "team management" of it. For instance, it'd be great to require 2FA for anyone who can access my repositories- or at least have a report on 2FA enrollment for those users.
fields.summary: Add "require 2FA", team management/reporting of 2FA

fields.description:
The BB Connect doco about [creating the canonical query string|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/bitbucket/concepts/understanding-jwt.html#qsh] fails to mention that after SHA-256 hashing, the resulting byte array needs to be hex-encoded. Here's what it says right now:

{quote}
Hash the canonical request bytes using the SHA-256 algorithm\\
e.g. The SHA-256 hash of "foo" is `"2c26b46b68ffc68ff99b453c1d30413413422d706483bfa0f98a5e886266e7ae
{quote}

In reality, the SHA-256 hash of "foo" is a byte array that in no way resembles the above string until it's hex-encoded using for example {{org.apache.commons.codec.binary.Hex#encodeHexString}}, as in the code sample found further down on that page (in the {{getQueryStringHash}} method). The reader should be able to get complete and accurate instructions without having to read code samples.

While you're changing this page, it would also be good to fix the unclosed quote characters in the section I quoted above.

FWIW, these mistakes seems to have originated on the [JIRA/Confluence Connect doco page|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/concepts/understanding-jwt.html] from which I assume the BB one was copied.
fields.summary: Connect doco fails to mention the need for hex encoding the canonical query string (BB-14287)

fields.description: There's no Java docs to authenticate a user using OAuth and even basic authentication for a user account on cloud. Also there's no valid examples for such authentication using JRJC 3.x or Jersy Rest support as well. Atleast provide info on the changes (if any for a cloud user) and provide clear instructions for a user to follow your documentation.
fields.summary: oauth authentication using jrjc 3.0 and cloud JIRA

fields.description:

String url = "https://bitbucket.org/site/oauth2/authorize?client_id=Tz2WPcatSdTnYh9S4Y&response_type=code&redirect_uri=http://140.205.156.9/sourceRepo/oauth4Bitbucket.json?userId=myUserId";
fields.summary: Can OAuth2.0 set different redirect_uri?

fields.description:
We have a conversion scenario where new files are being created in one directory based on files in another (but not outright replacing the old files, hence not just editing them).

People are keen to diff the original against the final, which effectively means an arbitrary diff of two files in a repo.

That is, they'd like to compare:

path1/foo.ext\\
path2/bar.ext

Currently the diff is within the same branch, but the more powerful the better.

While not a critical feature people are keen to use the same diff tool as much as possible and it would be nifty. It is possible to quickly make a snippet and view revisions, but it's a little clunky.
fields.summary: Diff any two files (BB-14652)

fields.description:
On the Bitbucket Connect [Authentication page|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/bitbucket/concepts/authentication.html], there is a "lifecycle attribute" link in this sentence:

bq. For details on the contents of the payload, please see the lifecycle attribute documentation.


This link points to https://developer.atlassian.com/static/bitbucket/modules/lifecycle.html, which gives a 404.
fields.summary: BB Connect doco has broken link to "lifecycle attribute" page (BB-14276)

fields.description:
A new feature added to Bitbucket with the introduction of two-step verification is the ability to reset a password over SSH using the command {{ssh git@bitbucket.org password}}. Bitbucket considers a user's private key to be on a machine that the user has control over at all times. Bitbucket offers [Deploy Keys|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Use%2Bdeployment%2Bkeys] for users that want a read-only SSH alternative.

However, for some users, this may not be a viable option, and a user's private key may be used in a variety of places. For this, allowing users to disable resetting a password over SSH may be a useful feature.
fields.summary: Allow users to disable password reset over SSH (BB-14268)

fields.description:
Without having the new two-factor verification system enabled, I tried the new(?) "ssh git@bitbucket.org password" command.

It let me change my password without even confirming the old password.

This worries me, because it means if an ssh key on a remote machine (mostly used for deployment) is compromised, an attacker will be able to change my bitbucket password without knowing my current password.

Please consider requiring the old password to be provided before accepting a password change. Or even better, provide an account setting for disabling the ssh password command completely.

(Also, it would be great to set some SSH keys as "read-only" in every way (repositories, or anything else the ssh interface provides), but that's probably better handled as a separate issue)
fields.summary: SSH "password" command allows setting a new password without confirming the old

fields.summary: Retrieve a deleted repository

fields.description:
The page in the BB Connect doco [about Authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/bitbucket/concepts/authentication.html] shows these two examples of making authenticated calls to a product's REST API:

!1610510403-Screen%20Shot%202015-09-10%20at%205.27.53%20pm.png|thumbnail!

Unfortunately the URLs shown belong to JIRA, not Bitbucket, which could be confusing for the reader.
fields.summary: Authentication examples in Connect doco use JIRA URLs

fields.description: Currently if I point my browser to: * https://bitbucket.org/%7B%7D/%7Ba311f4b3-8578-4c7e-a36d-576403e78335%7D BB rewrites this URL to: * https://bitbucket.org/AndrewSwan_au/%7Ba311f4b3-8578-4c7e-a36d-576403e78335%7D In other words, it inserts the correct account name for the repo, but leaves the repo's UUID in place. What would be better is if BB replaced the repo's UUID with its slug, which would result in a much more human-readable URL, like this: * https://bitbucket.org/AndrewSwan_au/akka-demo The reason I'm asking for this is that as a Connect add-on developer, I would like to be able to create an HTML link to a repo without have to use its owner or slug in the {{href}} URL, for example: {code} ... {code} This link takes the user to the correct repo page, but with an ugly URL in the user's address bar.
fields.summary: Rewrite repo UUID as repo slug in repo URLs (BB-14653)

* !1363252011-Screenshot%20from%202015-09-09%2015:43:04.png|thumbnail!

{code}
#!markdown

 * ![Screenshot from 2015-09-09 15:43:04.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/LboRq/images/1363252011-Screenshot%20from%202015-09-09%2015:43:04.png)
 * ![Screenshot from 2015-09-09 15:43:21.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/LboRq/images/2963823039-Screenshot%20from%202015-09-09%2015:43:21.png)
 * [Screenshot from 2015-09-09 15:43:04.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/LboRq/images/1363252011-Screenshot%20from%202015-09-09%2015:43:04.png)

 * https://bitbucket.org/repo/LboRq/images/2963823039-Screenshot%20from%202015-09-09%2015:43:21.png
{code}

As seen demonstrated above:

* inlining doesn't work
* linking doesn't work
* Only pasting bare url works

May be related to issue reported in comment section here as well:\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/mark-up-comments-305037452.html
fields.summary: Inline image functionality borked

fields.description:
Currently a bitbucket user can only use already "system preset" filters or searches.\\
Currently they are set to be:  All, Open , My Issues 'or' Watching.\\
These preset filters are not expandable to include users custom filters.

These filters are limiting to bitbucket users.

The bitbucket user can still accomplish a custom search from the advanced search link. However, a bitbucket user will have to "compose" a search every-time they search issues since:

* They do not have the ability to save a filter/search-query like they do in jira
* They do not have the ability to key in an issue query in the same screen: instead they have to navigate to a different screen. (you have still do it from the url query string...)

it would be nice for atlassian to add this feature. it will make the issue tracker more usable and they wouldn't feel that they have to use jira for every repo.
fields.summary: Custom filters in issue tracker (BB-660)

fields.description:
At the moment there is no place in the web user interface that repository owner can tag a commit. It is a waste of time and data traffic to clone the whole thing on your local drive, tag it and push it back !

I have a project that has a public repository and a private one. In private I work on my new ideas and on public one I encourage people to fork it and develop it. I don't have any local copy of the public repository and I create pull request from my devel repo to the public one. I can tag the commits in my devel repo but after the pull request is applied the tags are not going to show up in the public repo, so I think having this option would be good.
fields.summary: Allow tagging of commits in UI (BB-14651)

fields.description: You seem to have implemented a w=1 GET param to ignore whitespace in diffs. Can we get this for annotate/blame too? Both git and hg support a -w option for this.
fields.summary: Allow annotate/blame with whitespace ignoring (BB-14650)
